content: My wife has been through the texting training and has completed the forms and is ready to start texting but is having problems getting on the Team Harris-Walz channel. When she signs into Discord it looks like an old account. Can someone help us with this? Her name is "Melissa Black [Colorado]". Thanks.

Hi Michael! As promised, tagging <@568257600228032512> here for when she's on later. In the meantime, I've been casually told by another off-duty mod who is more fluent in discord the following, could try it:

That usually happens when multiple people share 1 computer to log into things, OR if the user has tried to log into discord from more than 1 device and accidentally created 2 accounts
You may have to log one account out and log the correct/new one in.

We're on two separate computers. She was doing fine the other night during training and thereafter until today. Today she has tried logging out of the one account and logging in to the other but it says the email/password is incorrect when she does that.
Is there some way she can be sent an email from someone and click on a link to go into Discord?
I think we need someone who knows Discord backwards and forwards.....
So we do that with the Zoom trainings but not the discord. It's just the one link to get into the discord, which is different from the Zoom.
Right.
I appreciate your efforts here.
Discord should send her a password reset email upon request.
I do know that much. Just wasn't sure if it was beyond my basic knowledge.
She did that and it reset the password for the old account - which she hasn't used for years and even then hardly at all.
Can someone have more than one Discord using the same email?
*account
Okay, so this appears to be a recovery issue. One moment. We can try some things!
There may be a conflict between the email address and phone number for the account. When it did the password reset, it did not allow her to login after, correct?
Yes she logged into her old account.

But when she logs out of that account and tries to log in to her new account it says the password is wrong. However - she is using the same email so if she says "Forgot Password" or whatever and she goes through all that to change it and then logs in again it just takes her to original account. I mean - she is IN Discord just not where she was the other night and with a different user name and an old profile photo.
Discord doesn't allow any user to use the same email for two different accounts. So that's where I'm confused and thinking it's something different.
OK well that answers one important question. I thought that might be the case. What about phone numbers?
Getting that now....

So this is a known issue apparently all over reddit and the discord support boards don't answer it because discord hasn't been great about responding to it. Some users claim that the best thing is to unlink and relink the phone number to re-verify the account with that email. 

Beyond this, Carolyn may have to help when she gets in tonight around 12p ET.
I'm sorry I can't be more helpful. We'll definitely be learning with you on this one so I'll keep watching to learn myself.

Hi! Discord usually lets you know that you've used the same phone number on a new account and that the phone is disconnected from the other account.
I can dig into this further. Are you using Discord in the browser or the Discord desktop app, or on mobile?

Discord in the browser. She completed the training earlier this week - did the little reports/exams/whatever - and received the DM on Discord the other night but then could not use the message field to respond. I forget what it said exactly but it had something to do with registering I think? Her username was consistent with Scale to Win and everything looked good to go but she couldn't respond to her DM for some reason. And then today she logged into Discord and went back to what appeared to be an old account with an old profile photo and old channels. Can she be looked up somehow? "Melissa Black [Colorado]".
Clear your browsing history (or switch to a browser that you have never used for Discord) power-cycle your PC and maybe your WiFi box too. Then go back to Discord and login with the new account.
Hm. OK we'll give that a shot.
OK thanks she logged in on Edge and it worked. Now when she is in "texting-campaigns" she is being prompted to "Claim Account" in the message field. What is this about?
<@&1245831006099996783> Is this what it does for onboarding text trainees into discord?
It says "This is an unclaimed account. Claim it before it's lost."
This where we got stuck the other night.
*is
Is this in Discord or in the texting app?
Discord.
If she sees "texting-campaigns" she is already in Discord
We have the join discord links in some campaigns. But we don't have tech support I guess.
Yes I know but she cannot use the message field in that channel.
Sounds like she just needs access to the teams channels
Nobody but admins and mods can post in that channel.

So that is because it's an announcements only channel but she should have access now to what she needs. We highly recommend she go to <#1268398483841220649> and <#1268398608097476750> which really help orient to our server and workflow, now that she's in.
OK understood. However - when I hear "Claim it before it's lost" I have concerns.

I found this
down on your Discord Account profile "While Viewing on the web" bottom left corner you will see your profile pic is not you, click it, and select switch account , and log in
Let's hope that goes away and doesn't happen again, doesn't sound like an in-discord message. Maybe something due to being on the web version?
i think your browser is in anonymous mode
When she tries to "Finish signing up" to "Claim Account" and enters her email it says it is already registered.
it's registered from the other account. Just a second
I did the onboarding for <@1275980193932251181> the other day. She should be all set to go from the text team perspective.
Yes thanks Kjirste! She is good to go for texting but there are some hiccups with Discord.
If she has another email she can change the old account to that email. If not I'll show you how to deleted the old acocunt.
She has one email. How can she delete the "old" account?

User Setting > My Account > Delete account.  under account removal
CAREFUL - Everything associated with that account will be lost. If you are unsure, go to Gmail and make a new email and we'll go the other route.
sorry I typed disable, but delete is what you want
Actually she has a viable yahoo account that she doesn't really use that could be used to dump the old account into.
What would she need to do to transfer the old account to that yahoo email account?

Go to User Settings by pressing your account's avatar 
Choose My Account.
Press the Email option.
Follow the prompts to input a new email address for your account and press the Save button.
Be sure to check the inbox of your updated email address for a verification email!
That all seemed to work - thanks for all your help!!!
So glad to hear this!
